positive.review:
Came back from office gave backshots to my homies opened my pc and played Human Fall Flat...........
10/10 EXPERIENCE!!!!

The only reason I got this game was for the new content and the nostalgia. Way back years ago I had this game on my nintendo switch lite. This game was a very good part of my childhood. I stopped playing the game around when the miniature level came out. Now with a PC I can experience all the shortcuts and glitches I experienced before. Also the music design is beautiful and I didn't appreciate it enough before. This review is a thank you because the joy you brought me, the memories.

A fun, whimsical game with god awful music and goofy characters with super wonky physics. Interesting and fun puzzles. The music makes funerals seem like a happy place that's how depressing and joyless it was and the grab mechanics are pretty horrible but a part from that it's a cool game.

Pretty broken achievement wise tho, because if you're playing with someone the host needs to be the one doing everything since it doesn't count if the guest does it.

Overall it was a bit tedious (some achievements) but still very fun 8/10, would throw my friend of the map again.
I used to play this with my bro and one night we did some ac!d and stayed up all night to beat it over night! the amount of laughs that came from this is beyond anything I've ever experienced

As a 100,000+ hour gamer, I love UNIQUE games that give an option for challenge.

Human Fall Flat is infinitely replayable(due to workshop maps), easy to learn the basics, and has a crazy high skill ceiling for advanced mechanics if you ever want to learn them(but are not necessary to learn[such as back flips and front flips!])

It's just a fun and different silly game that always makes me smile. What else could anyone want in a game?

"Human: Fall Flat" is one of those games thatâ€™s way more fun than it has any right to be. The physics are wobbly, the controls feel awkward at first â€” and yet somehow, thatâ€™s exactly what makes it so entertaining.

Once you get the hang of the mechanics, the game really opens up â€” and playing with friends takes it to another level entirely. The random, unplanned chaos leads to so many hilarious moments that youâ€™ll likely remember for a while!

There are tons of levels to play through, and even the tutorial is fun. The best part is, it doesnâ€™t have to end there â€” the community-made levels add endless replayability, especially when you bring them into a multiplayer lobby.

If you enjoy puzzle-solving, lighthearted chaos, and games that donâ€™t take themselves too seriously, this oneâ€™s an easy recommendation. Definitely got my moneyâ€™s worth.

Also worth mentioning â€” if youâ€™ve got the skills, try learning to climb walls like Spider-Man! Thanks, devs!

The commitment that the devs show to this game is honestly incredible and everyone should give it a try, specially if you are looking for a fun, yet challenging co-op game. The levels are all fun and rewarding, offering multiple ways of getting the puzzle done all based on your skill and ingenuity. The amount of community support adds to the experience, offering custom skins and levels. I promise you will have fun.

The second game is coming out soon, and long before Peak existed, this game was already here. If youâ€™ve only played Peak and never gave this one a try, I highly recommend giving it a chance, it truly deserves it.
9/10 ðŸ’«
Super fun and simple game, great for co-op, continually updaded with new content and levels. A myriad of puzzles, achievements are mostly fun to pursue, highly recommended.
I recommend for groups, its much more fun to flop around trying to coordinate your teammates. Its a very fun game and worth the price.

this game is so good, but the problems is about owners, who kicks me for no reason even if i did nothing to them they kicks me. It's very annoying. yall should add more levels like dark. add a way to friend the person u've played with in-game.
The best and funniest game, I reccomend everyone who wanna laugh.
it's a great game, but only if you have some friends to play with. new levels are released from time to time, with even more available in the workshop
One of the best goofiest games ever, the levels are so long though, could it be because my friends don't know how to use their hands ?

This is honestly one of the best games to play offline or in co-op. Itâ€™s relaxing, reduces anxiety, and is always a fun time. I usually play it while listening to my own personal playlist, but yeah solid 5/5 - I canâ€™t wait for Human Fall Flat 2 release!!
A reallly fun game with wacky physics. It is constantly being updated to this day with new levels, and some really creative fanmade things in the workshop maps.
I've played it accross many platforms, it is always fun w friends!

I wanted to play this game for a long time and I can say that it is definitely still worth picking up even after being out for so long and hff2 releasing soon, especially if you enjoy puzzles, platformers, and funky physics!

It can still be pretty fun playing solo but I would reccomend playing with friends for maximum [strike]chaos[/strike] fun.

Human fall flat is a fun game that I personally enjoyed playing alot. The gameplay mechanics are fun and wacky and will make you laugh a lot. If you have a friend to play together either online or offline, it'll be twice the fun. All the maps and puzzles are so good to complete and gives the game that special gameplay feel. Overall, human fall flat is a must play for people who look for a game that can be enjoyed truly to heart's content.
actual peak game to play with friends. different than those other friendslop games. wish there were frequent level updates tho </3

The only games I can manage to get multiple friends of mine to play together often are this and REPO. Top-tier party game for friends. There's a mod to increase the player cap to more than 8 players for bigger parties.
good puzzle game, recommend to play with friends.
the game is awesome but online mode is awful because of the extreme lag wich makes everything delayed and slow even if you use enthernet on your pc
Really funny goofy game to play with your friends. the characters actions are so goofy and sometimes questionable lol. would reccomend , play with a friend
Cool game but latest updates bring nothing new exept additional levels
Great game.. i have too many memories playing this game with my friends and laugh

My nephew loves this so i've bought to play with him. 
If youÂ´re going to play with a child, itÂ´s a nice game. Otherwise it is not worth it.
I grew up on this game along with a few others, but this game is on my top 3. I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes puzzles and a bit of goofyness lol.

Very fun game! But I have now managed too break and cheat my way out of every level I played.
10/10 for creative people who likes to find loop holes
Fun puzzle game with 3d graphics, Good level of difficulty.

me no like water stage
but i have skill issue so oh well
great multi player game otherwise

Played on xbox for a long while before getting it here on Steam. 
It's been a favorite for a long time, as it's been in the rotation of games forever! Easy to pick up, easy to play, and easy to chill with. Puzzles are just puzzling enough.
The physics, goofiness, and puzzles combined together make this game an absolute masterpiece. Can't wait for 2.
I liked the goofiness. I dislike that it's lame to me without company. Definitely play it with friends or your significant otter.

First playthrough review time.

Human: Fall Flat is a physics-based puzzle game with a quirky and light style, and I got this game for free. The character moves in a floppy and unpredictable way, which makes the puzzles interesting and sometimes challenging. Each level allows different approaches, so trying new ideas and exploring is an important part of the game.

The graphics are simple but clear, and every area has its own visual style. The physics often create unexpected situations that keep the gameplay lively and different. The design encourages experimenting with solutions and exploring every corner of each level.

The game also has small humorous moments that make it more engaging without distracting from the puzzles. Overall, Human: Fall Flat is a game with balanced gameplay, clear design, and a creative style that rewards exploration and experimentation.
Best multiplayer game ever. Lot's of fun and very interesting puzzle type adventurous mix type game best game and I love it.
This is the game where you don't need to play 100 hours to write something good about it, already played for 5 hours and it's a "YES" 100%! However you really need to have friends for it.

great game, just wish i had friends to play it with. even the guy i bought it for wont play it. 
games are cool. 
people are trash.

NGL if I had friends to play with this would be an amazing game to keep, however; I don't have anyone to play this game with and it FEELS like it is missing something huge! 
I would recommend this to anyone who has a group of friends and the time to play it cause the game play is amazing!
But, if you're getting this as a single player game, to me at least, it is not as fun solving the puzzles in single player (at least that's what it felt like to me)
this is a fun game with friends and alone and has goofy physics as well  would recommend

It's really fun, it has great mechanics. The way the body moves is hilarious like ragdoll. you can press r to literally collapse. and you can also chat using t. It's overall a fun multiplayer silly strategy puzzle game!
Great game, especially with friends. You may ruin your friendships though, be warned.
This game is entertaining but keeps your brain thinking! There's puzzles to solve, heights to climb, communication to build, and so much more. Thank you Human Fall Flat, this game is amazing!
this game is really fun and has also alot of achievements, its way more fun with friends but i hate the 100ms latency grrr
This is one of the best myltiplayer tricky game to play multiplayer

Human Fall Flat is a game where your biggest enemy isnâ€™t the level â€” itâ€™s yourself. Every jump feels like a gamble, and when you almost make it across the gap but miss grabbing the edgeâ€¦ thatâ€™s real pain.

Itâ€™s even worse when youâ€™ve spent half an hour carrying some heavy object to open a door, only to slip and fall off the map with it. Back to the start.

But the real chaos begins when you play with friends. One tries to help, another just gets in the way, and the third stands there laughing. And when your friend messes up, falls, or accidentally throws you off the edge â€” youâ€™re mad for five seconds, then laugh together anyway.

In Human Fall Flat, itâ€™s impossible to play â€œperfectly,â€ but youâ€™ll have tons of fun with everyoneâ€™s clumsy fails. Itâ€™s a game where even losing is hilarious.
I've played this game much more than just on Steam, and I can say I'm delighted by how much the devs have done from the launch to now. Looking forward to the sequel!

I was first introduced to Human Fall Flat when I was over at a friends house. I have the console, mobile port, and now computer version of the game. I appreciate the simplicity of the graphics so it can run on my laptop. I manage to get 30fps and sometimes more on the lowest graphics and on 1280 x 720 screen resolution. The only issue I have with this game is that if you use a laptop, you have to use the trackpad/intergrated mouse to look around. This may not sound like a problem, until it refuses to respond for a moment, and you have to stop what you're doing and shuffle it so it works again. And you will always have this issue. If you do decide to play this way, it's okay, but I really wish the developers can solve this problem because the game forgets that I use it to look around. My set up is WASD = Move, Trackpad/Intergrated Mouse = Look Around, Q/E = Left/Right Hand, N = Play Dead, and M = Player names. The set up works and that's really all I have to say about it. You're better off using a USB attached or Bluetooth controller. Other than this one persistent issue, I would recommend the game.
It's fun with friends, game is well maintained and devs keep adding new maps for free.

i really have a good time playing this game. i never laugh this hard in ages. highly recommend getting this. 
There's new map came out for free every now and then too! (I recommend do 100% of this game XD)

A fun game to play with friends. It is a game which has many hard and easy puzzle levels. But first of all it is has a split screen mode with which you can play with a friend on the same device which is very good.
great mutiplayer game that is really fun with playing with friends, created lots of memories and also comes out with new map all the time which are all unique each time

fun only if you play with friends. The physics are goofy, the controls feel like youâ€™re steering a drunk ragdoll, and solo play gets annoying fast. But with a group? It turns into pure chaos â€” shoving, grabbing, falling, laughing. Simple visuals, stupid fun. Great for multiplayer, meh alone.
I had too much of this game by now. Especially after the very dumb game design of making the camera mode a cheat and assigning a random button to it that will break your achievement progress -w-
Drunken physics and dumb puzzles. The real fun is griefing your friends while pretending to help. Perfect hangout game.

I played this back when it was new, I find the game to be good fun.

But that being said, I haven't kept up with it and probably won't play much of the newer content - i've had my fun here

Still would recommend
it is awesome and super kid friendly. there are NO glitches EVER. I WOULD RECOMMEND TO KIDS WHO LIKE TO LAUGH AND SPEND TIME WITH THEIR FAM.
If you have a friend or a group you like in your lobby, then you are going to have the best laughter in this game even if you don't finish the map.

Human: Fall Flat taught me two things:

I have no control over my life.

My character has the structural integrity of warm spaghetti.

1. I tried to grab a ledge. I grabbed the void instead.
2. I tried to walk in a straight line. I performed modern interpretive dance.
10/10, physics professors hate this game.
great game!  so many fun levels to play with freinds

Awesome with some fun creative friends, much to the chagrin of the bitter ones :D

Only with funny friends though
Good game I played with friends and itâ€™s so funny and I got my period blood spew out while laughing with my friends ):
If you play it alone, it's okay.  If you play it with friends, it's chaotic hilarity.

negative.review: Terrible latency on multiplayer + frustrating controls + jank physics puzzles = An experience I wouldn't recommend. That's not to say I haven't enjoyed the game at parts in spite of what I think are shortcomings because of the ability to cooperate with friends. For anyone considering playing the game for the first time if you have joint problems in your fingers know if you don't rebind m1 and m2 you will be holding those buttons for long periods of time whilst dragging the mouse around to puppet the player character. It could could hand or wrist strain.

I found the physics quite interesting, but the character is frustratingly difficult to control. It's one thing working out how to complete a level, quite another to get the character to do it.

At the beginning, the wobbly white bloke is cute, within an hour it just becomes annoying.

this game has two features. one feature is your independently controlled hands, which have the ability to grab objects and climb up ledges. the other feature is co-op, where many puzzles seem built around working together. if you have played any other game you will know that this is significantly less features than most have. even still, with that being taken under consideration, neither feature is implemented well

your hands are incredibly inconsistent. even while holding the grab buttons down, your hands will often completely randomly refuse to grab anything. i've had multiple occurrences where, while holding down both grabbing buttons for both of my hands, my hands not only refused to hold onto the ledge they were clearly touching, but were able to somehow physically push me away from that ledge still without grabbing hold. aiming the hands is also inconsistent. many times you will attempt to pick up an item on the ground only to allegedly miss and grab the ground itself over and over and over again. you are expected to perform delicate tasks with these unintuitive grab mechanics which is often, as you may expect, extremely frustrating

then there's the co-op. the game has online multiplayer with support for steam inviting and lobbies, which is great, but good god the game has the worst input delay i've ever encountered. it feels at times i'm playing on 1000ms ping. multiple times per level i will attempt to jump accross a long gap and have the button just not do anything, or will try to time something like a button press or a swing and end up being so far off. i regularly play other games with the same friend including other co-op puzzle games with no input delay, we both have good ping, and the same thing happens to him when he's not hosting. this implies it is a problem with the game, and as a game built entirely around co-op play, that is unacceptable

these two issues turn what would otherwise be a great funny physics games into a frustrating exercise of patience and unfortunately after completing most of the levels my patience is running thin

Just like the name of the game, it fell flat. Sure, it has a couple hundred players but they're usually silent or just speak a different language. I used to love playing this game and some of my rarest achievements are from me having a lotta fun here, but I just can't give it a thumbs up with the lack of motivation to play this dying game. The controls were weird and clunky, but fun to mess around with and maneuver, and the maps were somewhat interesting and had their own neat secrets and objects. 
It's a teamwork game (for it to actually be fun), but there's no team to play it with.
Unable to play this game for no good reason, please fix it.
If you got friends its prettty fun. I dont. its not fun.
stupid ass game, controls so wanky.
40-60 fps cap is crazy work even when v-sync is off:D
dull and boring and it looked so fun too
online has super high input delay
awful friend slop
Castle!
boring
soulless
I like playing it. but ever since an update I can't play it crashes on startup. that was too updates ago. I verified it and reinstalled it. and still nothing a lot of people are having same problem

I really want to love this because it seems fun, and I just bought 3 copies of it to enjoy with my kids, but somehow the FPS in this 8 year old game are *horrible* on my high end system at any settings. Resolution or any other texture, shadow, etc setting has no effect on performance at all. Game goes from buttery smooth 144fps to 5fps and back again, sometimes stutter/freezing as someone joins our game. The graphics are far too simple for the engine to be pushing my system.

I cant imagine this game is this badly optimized after this much time, and this many positive reviews. Ill try to read their forums to see why it plays like garbage I guess?

Edit: F this dev. They ignore customer service emails, and others have reported the issue (FPS drop in multiplayer) for years, meanwhile the dev is working on a sequel? I think not.

Terrible latency on multiplayer + frustrating controls + jank physics puzzles = An experience I wouldn't recommend. That's not to say I haven't enjoyed the game at parts in spite of what I think are shortcomings because of the ability to cooperate with friends. For anyone considering playing the game for the first time if you have joint problems in your fingers know if you don't rebind m1 and m2 you will be holding those buttons for long periods of time whilst dragging the mouse around to puppet the player character. It could could hand or wrist strain.

I found the physics quite interesting, but the character is frustratingly difficult to control. It's one thing working out how to complete a level, quite another to get the character to do it.

At the beginning, the wobbly white bloke is cute, within an hour it just becomes annoying.

this game has two features. one feature is your independently controlled hands, which have the ability to grab objects and climb up ledges. the other feature is co-op, where many puzzles seem built around working together. if you have played any other game you will know that this is significantly less features than most have. even still, with that being taken under consideration, neither feature is implemented well

your hands are incredibly inconsistent. even while holding the grab buttons down, your hands will often completely randomly refuse to grab anything. i've had multiple occurrences where, while holding down both grabbing buttons for both of my hands, my hands not only refused to hold onto the ledge they were clearly touching, but were able to somehow physically push me away from that ledge still without grabbing hold. aiming the hands is also inconsistent. many times you will attempt to pick up an item on the ground only to allegedly miss and grab the ground itself over and over and over again. you are expected to perform delicate tasks with these unintuitive grab mechanics which is often, as you may expect, extremely frustrating

then there's the co-op. the game has online multiplayer with support for steam inviting and lobbies, which is great, but good god the game has the worst input delay i've ever encountered. it feels at times i'm playing on 1000ms ping. multiple times per level i will attempt to jump accross a long gap and have the button just not do anything, or will try to time something like a button press or a swing and end up being so far off. i regularly play other games with the same friend including other co-op puzzle games with no input delay, we both have good ping, and the same thing happens to him when he's not hosting. this implies it is a problem with the game, and as a game built entirely around co-op play, that is unacceptable

these two issues turn what would otherwise be a great funny physics games into a frustrating exercise of patience and unfortunately after completing most of the levels my patience is running thin

Just like the name of the game, it fell flat. Sure, it has a couple hundred players but they're usually silent or just speak a different language. I used to love playing this game and some of my rarest achievements are from me having a lotta fun here, but I just can't give it a thumbs up with the lack of motivation to play this dying game. The controls were weird and clunky, but fun to mess around with and maneuver, and the maps were somewhat interesting and had their own neat secrets and objects. 
It's a teamwork game (for it to actually be fun), but there's no team to play it with.
Unable to play this game for no good reason, please fix it.
If you got friends its prettty fun. I dont. its not fun.
stupid ass game, controls so wanky.
40-60 fps cap is crazy work even when v-sync is off:D
dull and boring and it looked so fun too
White Crash in the beginning so annoying
online has super high input delay
i've never played or even own this game

What started like a great game become a nightmare because of the constant DLC's with achievements attached. 
If you eat something very good for a long time you get tired of it after a while.
I like playing it. but ever since an update I can't play it crashes on startup. that was too updates ago. I verified it and reinstalled it. and still nothing a lot of people are having same problem
Used too watch videos of this game as a kid. Now that I have it I would say it is very overrated. Maybe because I have only played alone but still for it's price it's so bland and boring

I really want to love this because it seems fun, and I just bought 3 copies of it to enjoy with my kids, but somehow the FPS in this 8 year old game are *horrible* on my high end system at any settings. Resolution or any other texture, shadow, etc setting has no effect on performance at all. Game goes from buttery smooth 144fps to 5fps and back again, sometimes stutter/freezing as someone joins our game. The graphics are far too simple for the engine to be pushing my system.

I cant imagine this game is this badly optimized after this much time, and this many positive reviews. Ill try to read their forums to see why it plays like garbage I guess?

Edit: F this dev. They ignore customer service emails, and others have reported the issue (FPS drop in multiplayer) for years, meanwhile the dev is working on a sequel? I think not.

this game has exactly 2 features and neither of them works.

the first feature is literally just physics. and it does not work. trying to interact with any actual physical surface in this game does not work in any consistent coherent manner. the game routinely forgets how grabbing works and insists that actually when i was holding my mouse button down i actually intended to just gently caress the wall instead of grabbing it. this is a stupidly annoying bug, as it happens at random and at great frequency. just fix it.

the second feature is multiplayer. i have never played a single multiplayer game with noticeable desync. i do not have a bad internet connection. and yet it seems that for anyone other than the host the game is entirely unplayable because you have to time every single physical action you take, predicting roughly how desynced you happen to be at the given moment and press buttons in advance accordingly. this adds a level of complete nonsensical drunkenness to the game, on top of the already drunk feeling involved in the physics engine.

the gameplay is occasionally fun, and the levels are occasionally interesting, but for the most part this game is completely unplayable. and the developers should be ashamed of themselves for leaving this many bugs in this simple a game for this duration of time. please fix the bugs or stop making games

Terrible latency on multiplayer + frustrating controls + jank physics puzzles = An experience I wouldn't recommend. That's not to say I haven't enjoyed the game at parts in spite of what I think are shortcomings because of the ability to cooperate with friends. For anyone considering playing the game for the first time if you have joint problems in your fingers know if you don't rebind m1 and m2 you will be holding those buttons for long periods of time whilst dragging the mouse around to puppet the player character. It could could hand or wrist strain.
